data.title: Get Current Census Data for Horicon, NY
data.meta_description: Need Horicon demographics? Get current population, race, age, income & poverty statistics for Horicon, NY from the US Census Bureau.
data.text:
Sources: United States Census Bureau. 2022 American Community Survey 5-Year Estimates. U.S. Census Bureau, American Community Survey Office. Web. 7 December 2023.

United States Census Bureau. Annual Estimates of the Resident Population: April 1, 2020 to July 1, 2023. U.S. Census Bureau, Population Division. Web. May 2024. http://www.census.gov/.

United States Census Bureau. Annual Estimates of the Resident Population: April 1, 2010 to July 1, 2019. U.S. Census Bureau, Population Division. Web. May 2021. http://www.census.gov/.

United States Census Bureau. "P2 Hispanic or Latino, and Not Hispanic or Latino by Race." 2020 Census State Redistricting Data (Public Law 94-171) Summary File. U.S. Census Bureau, 2020 Census. Web. 12 August 2021. https://www.census.gov/.

Check out our FAQs for more details.

Population

With 1,463 people, Horicon is the 1065th most populated city in the state of New York out of 1,524 cities. But watch out, Horicon, because Mayville with 1,457 people and Castleton-on-Hudson with 1,456 people are right behind you.

Race & Ethnicity

The largest Horicon racial/ethnic groups are White (99.1%) followed by Two or More (0.3%) and Other (0.3%).

Median Income

In 2022, the median household income of Horicon households was $69,310. Horicon households made slightly more than Coventry households ($69,286) and Tuscarora households ($69,231) . However, 4.5% of Horicon families live in poverty.

Median Age

The median age for Horicon residents is 55.0 years young.
